content: ever want to knit some*thing* but don t know what pick up a cute skein of yarn and you re certain it ll be good for some*thing* someday well here s *the thing* i bought a skein of amalgam 4 jill draper makes stuff at fibre space in alexandria while visiting home and knew i wanted it to be a constant accessory i have always found bandana scarves to be either too wide or too short- this solves that problem long ends make this the perfect piece to tie over a sweater or under a jacket initially this wasn t a pattern i was going to write up but i made it once…twice…three times then my mum made one and honestly it s just kind of really fun to knit and wear so *the thing* is now released into the world please enjoy the curl of the stockinette edge makes it really easy to tie and style in front and wear under a bulky coat or over a sweatshirt **materials** *yarn* jill draper makes stuff amalgam 4 76% welsh mountain black wool 24% targhee wool 270yds/247m/113g dk** colors used in sample mc amalgam 4 *needles* us size 5 3 75mm 24 /16 circulars *notions* tape measure tapestry needle scissors gauge 3 75mm 15 stitches and 20 row = 4 gauge is calculated for the piece post-blocking *yardage* 250yds / 228m / 105g *sizes* measurements are given post-blocking sizes 1 size fits all instructions for adjusting to a specific yarn weight finished length 84 213cm finished width at point 12 30cm
